priorities.current_focus: Advanced Features - Priority: Ollama provider, cost optimization, Claude Pro/Max auth, then intelligence learning

project.name: Aircher
project.description: Advanced AI terminal assistant with intelligent context management

PHASE1-001.title: Project Infrastructure
PHASE1-001.description: Initialize Rust project with proper structure and tooling
acceptance_criteria: Initialize Rust project with proper Cargo.toml structure
Set up Cargo build system with comprehensive commands
Establish project directory structure following Rust standards

PHASE1-002.title: Configuration System
acceptance_criteria: Design hierarchical TOML configuration system
Support Provider ‚Üí Model ‚Üí Host selection hierarchy

PHASE1-003.title: Multi-Database Architecture
PHASE1-003.description: Implement separate SQLite databases for different data types
acceptance_criteria: Design separate databases (conversations, knowledge, file_index, sessions)
Integrate sqlx for type-safe async database operations

PHASE1-004.title: Terminal User Interface (TUI)
PHASE1-004.description: Build responsive TUI framework with Ratatui
acceptance_criteria: Implement Ratatui TUI framework with async support
Provider ‚Üí Model ‚Üí Host selection modal design
Build modular component system (chat, selection, status)

SPRINT-001.title: Claude API Provider Implementation
SPRINT-001.description: Complete Anthropic API integration with streaming support - PRIORITY #1
acceptance_criteria: Implement async Anthropic API client with reqwest
Support streaming responses with SSE parsing using tokio
Integrate with Provider ‚Üí Model ‚Üí Host hierarchy
Handle Anthropic-specific errors and rate limiting
Support multiple Claude models (Claude-3.5-Sonnet, Claude-3-Haiku, Claude-3-Opus)
Implement accurate token counting for per-token cost management
API key authentication with environment variable support
SPRINT-001.notes:
‚úÖ Core Rust project structure implemented
‚úÖ Claude API provider implemented with async/streaming support
‚úÖ Configuration system with TOML support
‚úÖ Provider ‚Üí Model ‚Üí Host hierarchy designed
‚úÖ Basic error handling and logging
‚è≥ Next: Add TUI implementation and testing

SPRINT-001B.title: Claude Pro/Max Subscription Integration
SPRINT-001B.description: Integrate Claude Pro/Max subscription usage like Claude Code - requires client registration
acceptance_criteria: Implement session-based authentication for Claude Pro/Max subscriptions
Track usage against subscription limits (not token costs)
Display usage like Claude Code: '44k/200k' style indicators
Support Pro vs Max tier detection and different usage limits
Handle subscription renewal and limit reset cycles
Warning notifications when approaching usage limits
Graceful fallback when subscription limits exceeded
SPRINT-001B.notes:
‚úÖ BREAKTHROUGH: OpenCode uses Claude Code's OAuth flow (shows 'claude code' in browser)
‚úÖ Infrastructure ready: PricingModel::Subscription and SubscriptionTier enums
‚úÖ No separate Anthropic registration needed - can reuse Claude Code OAuth client
üîÑ Next: Research OpenCode's implementation of Claude Code OAuth flow
üìã Implementation approach: Mirror OpenCode's session-based auth system

acceptance_criteria: Implement async Gemini API client with reqwest
Support streaming responses with SSE parsing using tokio
Integrate with Provider ‚Üí Model ‚Üí Host hierarchy

SPRINT-003.title: Host Integration (OpenRouter)
SPRINT-003.description: Implement OpenRouter host integration for cost optimization
acceptance_criteria: Implement OpenRouter API client integration
Support Provider ‚Üí Model ‚Üí Host selection in UI

SPRINT-004.title: Intelligence Engine - Contextual Development Assistant
SPRINT-004.description: Implement context-aware development assistant that provides intelligent insights for AI agents
acceptance_criteria: Implement tool-based interface for AI agent integration
Build contextual relevance engine with multi-layered scoring
Create development narrative tracker for project story
Implement basic conversational memory system
Add predictive context assembly capabilities
Integrate with git2 for development momentum tracking
Use tree-sitter for AST analysis and dependency mapping
Store learning models in SQLite for pattern recognition
Provide dynamic system prompt component integration
Achieve <100ms response time for context queries
SPRINT-004.notes:
‚úÖ Complete Intelligence Engine implementation with tool-based interface
‚úÖ Multi-layered contextual relevance scoring (immediate/sequential/dependent/reference/historical)
‚úÖ Development narrative tracking with git history analysis
‚úÖ Conversational memory system for learning from outcomes
‚úÖ Project momentum analysis and architecture direction detection
‚úÖ File discovery and impact analysis with dependency tracking
‚úÖ Context suggestions and missing dependency identification
‚úÖ Thread-safe implementation with Arc<Mutex<Repository>> for git integration
‚úÖ Comprehensive test suite with 4 passing tests
‚úÖ Full integration with ConfigManager and DatabaseManager
‚è≥ Next: SPRINT-005 (Session Management and Persistence)

SPRINT-005.title: Session Management and Persistence
SPRINT-005.description: Implement conversation persistence and session management
acceptance_criteria: Save and restore conversation sessions
Session search and organization
Export conversations to various formats (JSON, Markdown, CSV, Plain)
Session cost tracking and analytics
Resume interrupted conversations
SQLite-based persistence with full CRUD operations
CLI commands for session management
Project-based session management with .aircher/ directories
SPRINT-005.notes:
‚úÖ Complete session management implementation with SQLite persistence
‚úÖ Full CRUD operations for sessions and messages
‚úÖ Multi-format export capabilities (JSON, Markdown, CSV, Plain)
‚úÖ Session analytics and cost tracking
‚úÖ CLI integration with session commands
‚úÖ Project-based session management with .aircher/ directory detection
‚úÖ Comprehensive test suite with 12 test functions
‚úÖ Integration with TUI and Intelligence Engine
‚è≥ Next: SPRINT-007 (Ollama Provider) or SPRINT-001B (Claude Pro/Max Auth)

SPRINT-007.title: Ollama Local Provider Implementation

SPRINT-008.title: Cost Optimization and Tracking
acceptance_criteria: Real-time cost tracking per provider/model/host

SPRINT-010.title: Intelligence Engine - Learning System
SPRINT-010.description: Advanced learning capabilities for the Intelligence Engine
acceptance_criteria: Implement advanced conversational memory with outcome tracking
Build pattern recognition system for successful context assemblies

Create learning models that improve over time

SPRINT-015.title: Intelligence Engine - Advanced Features
SPRINT-015.description: Advanced intelligence features for cross-project learning and architectural guidance

CLI-001.title: Basic CLI Functionality
CLI-001.description: Create a working CLI that can handle one-shot chat requests
acceptance_criteria: Handle command line arguments with clap
Support basic usage: aircher 'hello world'
Return response from Claude API (single provider focus)
Graceful error handling for missing API keys
Simple configuration loading (API key from env)
Basic help and version information
Exit codes for success/failure scenarios
CLI-001.notes:
‚úÖ Working CLI with clap argument parsing
‚úÖ One-shot mode: aircher 'message'
‚úÖ Help and version commands
‚úÖ Graceful error handling for missing API keys
‚úÖ Clean error messages without panic traces
‚úÖ Provider and model selection flags
‚úÖ Lazy provider loading (only when needed)
‚è≥ Next: CLI-002 (Interactive Chat Mode)

CLI-002.title: Interactive CLI Chat Mode
CLI-002.description: Add interactive chat mode for back-and-forth conversations
acceptance_criteria: Interactive mode: aircher (no arguments)
Conversation loop with > prompt
Message history within session
Ctrl+C to exit gracefully
Basic commands: /help, /quit, /clear
Show token usage and cost after each response
Support for different models: --model flag
CLI-002.notes:
‚úÖ Complete interactive CLI chat mode implementation
‚úÖ Conversation loop with > prompt
‚úÖ Message history within session
‚úÖ Commands: /help, /quit, /clear, /history, /model
‚úÖ Token usage and cost display
‚úÖ Support for different models and providers
‚úÖ Graceful error handling
